div.head: 7.6.1884 Samstag
div.p: This morning I was woke at half past three to see the sun rise and did not like it all. It was not worth ones while to get up so early to see so little. I went to bed again then and got up again at 8 o’clock had breakfast and packed my things. When all was ready I went down into the garden and looked through the telescope. When aunt Lulu came down we went up to the Bülow’s Höhe and from there to the Rosstrappe where we made the man shoot so that we might hear the echo and gave him 30 pf. for it. We then walked down the Schurre into the Bodethal, and from there walked on to the Teufelsbrücke. On both sides high rocks fall almost straight into the Bode which rushes on through the Kessel foaming and raging. On the other side of the Teufelsbrücke we walked on a little way and then turned and walked to the Waldkater by the Königsruhe and the Jungfernbrücke. From the Waldkater I walked up the Hexentreppe, 1120 high steps some of them loose, some high and some low, to the Hexentanzplatz. Aunt Lulu drove up. At the top I had a glass of milk and spent the time till the carriage came in walking to the Riesenschloss and looking at the scenery. We then drove down to Hotel Zehpfund in Thale and had dinner there looked at the shops and bought some things and went to the Waldkater where we had coffee. At half past four we drove away from Thale to the Regenstein near here which is very interesting. There is a ruin of a castle on it which was besieged and taken by Frederick the great by his bombarding the well and smashing it up so that the French who where in it could get no more water in 1756. We also saw the outhöhle in one of which a princess of Heimburg was shut up but bored her way through the thinnest part of the wall with her ring! Most of the remaining rooms are hewn out of the rock and there is still a tower in it built by Henry I the Birdcatcher in the 10th century. The Romans were here too, and in olden times it was a Raubburg one of the counts let himself out of a window was taken and put into a wooden box. From the Regenstein we drove to Blankenburg to the Weisse Adler where we have two very nice large rooms. In the evening we went to the Thie and heard the band.
